item.title: Trunk Calls Soothe Lonely Elephants
item.description:
The rapid development of smartphone apps, particularly after the iPhone’s release, has provided solutions for almost every need. But could technology address something as unique as an elephant’s loneliness? Interestingly, a simple cell phone offered a solution for two elephants, Devi and Rahul, at the Okinawa Zoo. When these Bengal elephants were relocated from India, they became despondent and difficult to manage without their familiar trainers, known as mahouts. To address this, the zookeepers devised a heartwarming solution: they used cell phones to allow the elephants to hear the voices of their mahouts back in India...
